#lectureNotes 
[[Intro to sensing]]

Sensing > Learning and computing > Communication and Networking > Sensing

Traditionally sensing was separated from computing with data storage in between

Nowadays, real-time actions are more common and expected

Sensing tells what is in the physical environment

[[Sensors]] just gets data, sensing system can act on the sensed data

[[Sensors]] has Structure or material that reacts > Circuit that converts the reaction to measurable electrical signal > interpretation/storing

Scalar vs Vector output

Scalar is just a number, vector is directional

Global coordinate system has space that is defined, with a sensor inside that space

Each sensor may have its own coordinate system, where it is the point (0,0)

Vector data output ![](data:image/png;base64,)

[[Inertial Measurement Unit]] - [[Accelerometer]], [[Gyroscope]], [[Magnetometer]]

[[Accelerometer]] measures linear acceleration along 3 axes

[[Gyroscope]] measures rotational velocity along 3 axes

[[Magnetometer]] measures strength and direction of the earths magnetic field.
